summary: Treasure hunt that starts with finding the 12 treasure maps and sends you to the Aetherium Forge to craft a key. The Aetherium Key will open a small vault filled with treasure ... If you can find it.
descriptionHtml:
[center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65163/?][img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/images/110/2446084-1430064887.png[/img][/url][/center]
Requires: Dawnguard DLC


[center][img]http://files.enjin.com/631988/zzzPublicNexus/Treasure/_Treasure.jpg[/img][/center]


[center][size=3]A [color=#BF9000]treasure hunt[/color] that starts with finding the [color=#BF9000]12 treasure maps[/color] and sends you to the Aetherium Forge to craft a [color=#b6d7a8]key[/color]. 
The [color=#b6d7a8]Aetherium Key[/color] will open a small [color=#BF9000]vault[/color] filled with [color=#BF9000]treasure[/color]. . . If you can find it![/size][/center]


[center][img]http://files.enjin.com/631988/zzzPublicNexus/Treasure/_description1-alt2.jpg[/img][/center]

When you find one of the [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Map_Notes]treasure maps around Skyrim[/url] (keep the maps, they must be in your inventory) Discover the chest that the map points to and a portal will open nearby. Where the portal was you'll discover a mysterious dwemer box. Take what's inside and you will be on the hunt for my treasure.

Once you have found all 12 chests, descend into the[url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Lost_to_the_Ages] Aetherium Forge (which you must unlock first)[/url]. There you can craft a special key.


[center][size=3]"Examine the [color=#93c47d]key[/color] closely for [color=#a4c2f4]hints[/color] to finding the location of my [color=#BF9000]treasure vault[/color].

The only [color=#9fc5e8]hint[/color] available for finding the [color=#BF9000]vault [/color]... It has an affinity for dwemer ruins.

After locating the [color=#BF9000]vault[/color], enter and start collecting your [color=#B45F06]rewards[/color]!

[color=#e06666][u]Be warned though[/u][/color] ... after leaving the [color=#BF9000]vault[/color] it will be returned to [color=#a64d79]Oblivion[/color] along with the [color=#93c47d]key[/color]."[/size][/center]

[center][img]http://files.enjin.com/631988/zzzPublicNexus/Treasure/_description4.jpg[/img][/center]

Luck is on your side though. After looting the vault, if you revisit one of the treasure chests, you may begin a new hunt. :)


[img]http://files.enjin.com/631988/zzzPublicNexus/SoT Temper Recipes/_Acknloweledgements.jpg[/img]

Bethesda - For making the excellent Elder Scrolls series and also for releasing the CK
The Nexus Staff- For putting together a forum for sharing mods and bringing together this community
GhostAgent - For creating the logo (at top) and for the description page, design, and graphics

Thank you :)
author: Jebbalon

files.name: Jebbalon's Treasure
files.changelogHtml:
Initial release - Considered BETA
Please report anything and everything regarding the mod in the comments - screen shots help

files.name: Jebbalons Treasure
files.changelogHtml:
Corrected animation on vault entrance teleporter
Made world objects persistent to 'clear' world cell edits - makes mod a little cleaner - minor and shouldn't cause issues but may throw log error for updaters.

files.name: Jebbalons Treasure
files.changelogHtml:
Added more loot to vault via my leveled item list and chests too
Added way to get Velehk Sain's map even if you banish him (just step out of the room and my box will appear)

files.name: Jebbalons Treasure
files.changelogHtml:
Cleaned up quest objectives after finding the vault. Will make journal a bit tidier when searching for the vault again.
Further tweaks to my leveled item list.
Added "copy" to the name of Velehk's Map that I copied
